item.description:
Earth and Human: A Planetary Perspective
Lecture by Charles Langmuir

The interaction between humans and the environment is generally discussed in terms of the time scale of human civilizations, sometimes extending to recent ice ages. But that timespan covers less than 0.02% of earth history. Charles Langmuir, Higgins Professor of Geochemistry at Harvard University, will present a longer view of planetary evolution and how events from the Big Bang to the formation of oceans, minerals, and atmosphere are relevant to understanding the relationship between human beings and the Earth.

This lecture is part of the
Earth Matters
program at the
Harvard Museum of Natural History.
item.name: Earth and Human
